results.title: Snapshot = Day after Halloween = Day before Halloween  [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Antony Ginnane, William Fayman, AIFC and Simon Wincer
results.brief_description: Sigrid Thornton stars in this dramatic thriller as Angela, a young hairdresser who has just split up with her boyfriend Daryl (Vincent Gil). Daryl is obsessed by Angela and can’t move on after their break-up and follows her around in his “Mr Whippy” van. Upon meeting the exotic and glamorous Madeline (Chantal Contouri) Angela gives up hairdressing to try out as a model in glamour photography. Her first shoot is a topless one and suddenly she becomes very popular - the quick fame and money is a case of too much too soon and her youth and inexperience lead Angela to be manipulated. Tensions also rise as she becomes victim to an anonymous stalker. With music by Brian May, two songs performed by Sherbet and shot on location in Melbourne, this is also a snapshot of the city in the late 1970s. Released in the United States as “The Day before Halloween”. Note: the quality of the transfer to DVD is low. Cast includes Denise Drysdale, Robert Bruning, Julia Blake, Hugh Keays-Byrne, Bob Brown.

results.title: Snakes and how they live
results.brief_description: Relates major pertinent concepts about snakes, using a great variety of types to show how they move, eat, shed skin, etc. An open-ended approach stimulates class discussion. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Snake eyes
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Touchstone and Brian De Palma
results.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of a high profile boxing match, gaudy casino and an immanent hurricane, this essentially interior crime thriller centres around 2 friends and law enforcement agents, one of whom may or may not be corrupt. Detective Ray Santoro (Nicolas Cage) is an Atlantic City cop, willing to take a bribe, dreaming of being on television, and always getting results. He meets his long time friend, Navy Commander Kevin Dunne (Gary Sinise), ringside, at a heavyweight bought signalling the swan song of the Atlantic City arena, where they, along with thousands of spectators witness the political assassination of the U.S Secretary of Defence. The stadium is shut down as Santoro leads the investigation, searching for a mysterious woman (Carla Gugion) seen speaking to the secretary shortly before he was killed. Dunne, meanwhile, is taking credit for locating the shooter, a Palestinian fall guy. As Santoro finds his witness, he learns of a conspiracy involving the Norfolk testing and learns the shocking truth about his friend. With state of the art surveillance equipment in the stadium, all eyes are watching proceeding and nothing can escape detection. When the truth is finally revealed, Santoro is forced to question his loyalty to Dunne, and whether he will live up to his reputation as a corrupt cop. Cast also includes John Heard, Stan Shaw and Michael Rispoli.

results.title: Snail mail
results.creator_credit: Tellit, Mike Edwards and Hazel Edwards
results.brief_description: Hazel Edwards reads her story to children in her living room. This is followed by question time from the children, an adult face-to-face interview and hazel visiting a school library.

results.title: Snacks count too
results.creator_credit: Journal Films and Gilbert Altschul Productions
results.brief_description: What you eat makes a difference - proper nutrition is still a problem. This film examines the factors that lead to excess snacking and further explains the nutritive elements of popular snack foods.

results.title: Smultronstallet = Wild strawberries
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, Allan Ekelund and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description:
An aged professor - introverted and emotionally cold - makes a journey to collect a university award and en route relives his past through recollection, dreams and imagination. Borg emerges purged, if not wholly changed from this confrontation with self. The theme of the film, incarnated in the successive generations of the Borgs, is death-in-life, emotional-spiritual atrophy. It has been compared with King Lear and Strindberg’s Dream Play and in structure with a Bach fugue. Wild strawberries are a Swedish symbol for the emergence of spring, the rebirth of life. Also available on 16mm and VHS.

Credits: [Producer, Allan Ekelund] ; director, writer, Ingmar Bergman ; photography, Gunnar Fischer ; music, Erik Nordgren.
Cast: Victor Sjostrom, Ingrid Thulin, Bibi Andersson, Gunnar Bjornstrand.

results.title: Smuggler's Cove
results.creator_credit: Andromeda Productions, Tom Broadbridge and Peter Sharp
results.brief_description: A day surfing for a group of teenagers turns into the adventure of a lifetime when they stumble across a group of cut-throat drug smugglers. Based on the novel, “Deadman’s float” by Roger Carr and starring Sally Boyden, Greg Rowe, Bill Hunter, Gus Mercurio, Ernie Sigley and Bunney Brooke.

results.title: Smoking: the choice is yours
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and John Ewing
results.brief_description: A Disney animated production dealing with some of the issues of smoking. The central character decides to try smoking in an effort to gain respect from others. A courtroom scene occurs where the pros and cons of smoking are debated and eventually the hero decides not to smoke. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Smoking: Pete Ennis doesn't smoke yet
results.brief_description: Explores the varius pressures and forces which may tend to influence an individual’s decision on whether or not to smoke. Considers the medical aspects of smoking and points out that the longer an individual smokes the harder it is for them to stop. Designed to promote discussion about smoking.

results.title: Smoking: it's your choice
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and Alfred Higgins
results.brief_description: An open-ended film designed to stimulate thought and class discussion; the aim of this film is to help young people make a decision about smoking cigarettes. Animation is used to show how smoking affects the lungs, causing diseases such as lung cancer and emphysema.
